item.title: How to find your talent, practice it and achieve greatness
item.description:
How to find your talent, practice it and achieve greatness

It was 4.30 on a cold and wet morning and I was choking on the stench of thick layers of years old grease behind the deep fat fryer and I was ecstatically happy as I scrubbed and cleaned the once white tiles back to their original gleaming brightness.

item.title: The Elephant and Rider - How to Influence Change
item.description:
The Elephant and Rider - How to Influence Change

Why is it, that with our very best intentions, we still find it difficult to make changes that we know would be good for us? It seems that it's down to our inner elephant. I've borrowed the analogy used by University of Virginia psychologist Jonathan Haidt in his wonderful book The Happiness Hypothesis.

item.title: How to influence someone you don't know well-4 appeals
item.description:
How to influence someone you don't know well-4 appeals

Jeff sat on a bar stool at the front of the room. He had no slides, no props, just sat and talked. Within minutes, he had everybody in the room on the edge of their seats eagerly nodding and ready to follow him wherever he went.
